I'm working on blurays only... I believe this is the 5th time you've repeatedly asked for or about max payne.
Thank you for the great encodes. I just have one question. Why do you sometimes do 1920x816 and sometimes 1920x1080?

Because of the aspect ratio..

Rarely are any movies encoded at anything above 800/816 because the movies are presented in letterbox widescreen.

There is no point... actually it is counter productive to encode a movie with those giagantic BLACK bars above and below the actual film.

A few movies actually use 1920x1040..

As I said, it's rather still rare for any movie to be available @ 1920x1080.

Trust me you aren't missing anything. If anything, you are gaining BETTER quality video at a smaller file size.
